summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Blog CMS feature. All 21 backend API tests passed. Frontend UI testing confirmed Blog page, Admin Blog tab, article creation form, and single article view all render correctly with proper data-testid attributes and dual-language support.

backend: GET /api/blog/categories - Returns 5 categories with dual-language names
GET /api/blog/featured - Returns featured articles without full content
GET /api/admin/blog/articles?status=all - Admin can list all articles
POST /api/admin/blog/articles - Create article with dual-language content
GET /api/blog/articles/{slug} - View count increments on each view
Article has all dual-language fields (title_id, title_en, content_id, content_en, etc.)
Article has required metadata (article_id, slug, category, tags, status, author_name, views, created_at)
frontend: BlogPage renders with 'Blog & Artikel' header
BlogPage has back-home link with data-testid='back-home'
BlogPage has 'All' filter button with data-testid='filter-all'
BlogPage has category filters for all 5 categories (communication, relationships, archetypes, tips, stories)
BlogPage shows 'Belum ada artikel' when no articles exist
BlogPage displays article cards with proper data-testid='article-{slug}'
AdminPage Blog tab renders with 'Blog Articles' header
AdminPage has 'New Article' button
AdminPage article form has all dual-language fields (Title ID/EN, Excerpt ID/EN, Content ID/EN)
AdminPage article form has Slug, Category, Tags, Status fields
AdminPage article form has Create and Cancel buttons
Article creation shows success toast 'Article created!'
Created article appears in admin list with status badge
Created article appears on public blog page
Single article view shows category badge, date, view count
Single article view renders markdown content (headings, lists)
Single article view shows tags and author info
Single article view has 'Kembali ke Blog' button with data-testid='back-to-blog'
Route /blog works correctly
Route /blog/:slug works correctly

critical_code_review_comments: Blog CMS feature is well implemented with proper dual-language support (ID/EN)
Categories are hardcoded in BLOG_CATEGORIES constant - consider moving to database for admin management
Article view count increments correctly on each page view
Slug uniqueness is properly enforced with 400 error on duplicates
Admin endpoints properly protected with get_admin_user dependency
Featured articles endpoint excludes full content for performance
seed_data_creation: Created and cleaned up TEST_ prefixed blog article during UI testing

mocked_apis.resend_email: Returns mock success when RESEND_API_KEY is empty

context_for_next_testing_agent: Iteration 6 Blog CMS feature is fully working. Blog supports 5 categories (communication, relationships, archetypes, tips, stories) with dual-language content (ID/EN). Admin can create/edit/delete articles with title, excerpt, content in both languages, plus slug, category, tags, and status (draft/published). Public blog page shows published articles with category filters. Single article view renders markdown content with view count tracking. All data-testid attributes are properly implemented for testing.
